intro: Orthosiphon muddii, commonly known as Malabar tea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers. It is often cultivated for its leaves, which are used in traditional medicine. The botanical features of Orthosiphon muddii make it well adapted to tropical and subtropical environments.
